channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA

item.title: Report I-2024070005
item.description:
Report I-2024070005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-20T00:36:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROSS EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The freight was not secured in the trailer coming from Pitt Ohio with a trailer seal on the door. As the trailer was moving to Ross/Auburn, MA terminal the freight shifted and 1 box of 6 boxes shift, broke open causing 4 cans to be damaged as cans of paint leaked in the trailer. The paint only leaked in the yard when the doors were opened. No paint reached any drains. Paint cleanup was performed after it was determined what the proper HM clean up procedure needed to be followed to protect Ross employees. A dock employee then took the damaged box of paint off the pallet in the trailer. The damaged- 1 box/4- 1 gallon cans and cleaning materials used for cleanup were placed in a recovery drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070434
item.description:
Report E-2024070434

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MILFORD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: New England Disposal Technologies was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and a 1ft-by-3ft area of concrete underneath the trailer and estimated that eight (8) cups of material was released due to the valve being semi open. New England Disposal Technologies personnel neutralized the impacted areas and deployed absorbents. The remaining material in the leaking tote was transferred to a new tote. The leaking tote and recovered material were cut up and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024070017
item.description:
Report I-2024070017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Ross Express, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ROSS FORKLIFT OPERATOR WAS MOVING FREIGHT ON THE DOCK FROM A TRAILER ANO HAD HM ON A PALLET ON THE FORKS. UNKNOWN RIGHT AWAY TO THE FORKLIFT OPERATOR THE FORKLIFT FORKS HAD PUNCTURED AN INDIVIDUAL BOX-> 1 BOX OF 66 BOXES ON A PALLET/1 BLADDER WAS PUNCTURED. AFTER DETERMINING A SAFE AND PROPER COURSE OF ACTION. THE FORKLIFT OPERATOR TOOK THE DAMAGED BOX OF HM OFF THE PALLET. THE DAMAGED- 1 BOX/1 BADDER AND CLEANUP SUPPLIES USED WERE PLACED IN A HM RECOVERY DRUM FOR DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report E-2024070355
item.description:
Report E-2024070355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: SHREWSBURY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported 2-quarts of a UN1866 Everclear 350 released to the dock from a 5-gallon pail due to improper loading by the previous service center. It was reported the clean up was completed by in house personnel and the waste contents were placed into a 10-gallon metal drum for disposal.
